member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.NaiveExtendedEngine
member.summary: This class is automatically used by RxStorage when the Engine is initialized and the Engine class does not support IExtendedStorageEngine; in this case, NaiveExtendedEngine wraps the Engine and implements the extended methods in a very naive, brute-force way.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IExtendedStorageEngine
member.summary: IExtendedStorageEngine provides additional methods that would most likely be needed by applications. If this interface is not explicitly implemented in storage implementations, a naive low performance implementation that uses the IStorageEngine methods will be used.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IStorageEngine
member.summary: IStorageEngine is the core interface for classes that can maintain and persist list of sync points. Its core responsibilities are to quickly Load and Save individual objects, and create and list Sync Points (objects that represent an atomic commit to the Storage engine)

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IStorageEngine.Load``1(System.Guid)
member.summary: Loads an object given its Content Hash. Note that it is critical that separate calls to Load with the same ContentHash return two distinct in-memory copies of the object - i.e. maintaining an "object cache" will result in object corruption.
member.param: The hash of the object to load.
member.returns: The deserialized object, or null if the object is not present.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IStorageEngine.Load(System.Guid)
member.summary: Loads an object given its Content Hash. Note that it is critical that separate calls to Load with the same ContentHash return two distinct in-memory copies of the object - i.e. maintaining an "object cache" will result in object corruption.
member.param: The hash of the object to load.
member.returns: The deserialized object, or null if the object is not present.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IStorageEngine.Save``1(``0)
member.summary: Saves an object to the persistence engine. Note that this does *not* imply that the object is immediately written to the backing store, the engine is free to postpone serialization.
member.param: The object to save.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IStorageEngine.FlushChanges
member.summary: When called, guarantees all objects are serialized to a persistent store.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IStorageEngine.GetAllObjectHashes
member.summary: Returns the content hash of all objects in the store.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IStorageEngine.GetObjectCount
member.summary: Returns the count of available objects.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IStorageEngine.CreateSyncPoint``1(``0,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: Creates a Sync Point using the specified root object and qualifier and persists it to the engine. This sync point will be attached to the parent sync point for this type and qualifier.
member.param: The Root Object to attach to this sync point.
An optional string to create separate sync point lists (i.e. "branches") - this is a string provided by the application or null.
The date that the sync point was created, or null to use the current time.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created sync point

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IStorageEngine.GetOrderedRevisionList(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: GetOrderedRevisionList returns the list of Sync Points commited for the given root object Type and qualifier.
member.param: The Type of the root object associated with the Sync Point.
An optional string to create separate sync point lists (i.e. "branches") - this is a string provided by the application or null.
member.returns: A list of content hashes, in the order that they were committed. Note that this does *not* necessarily correlate to the CreatedOn date since it can be explicitly set.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IExtendedStorageEngine.GetLatestRootObject``1(System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: Load the root object associated with the the latest Sync Point for the given type and qualifier whose CreatedAt date is older than the given date.
member.param: An optional string to create separate sync point lists (i.e. "branches") - this is a string provided by the application or null.
member.returns: The root object from the latest Sync Point that satisfies the given constraints.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IExtendedStorageEngine.GetRootObjectsInDateRange``1(System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: Loads the root objects whose CreatedAt date fall within the given date ranges.
member.param: An optional string to create separate sync point lists (i.e. "branches") - this is a string provided by the application or null.
member.returns: All root objects whose Sync Points satisfy the given constraints, or an empty array if none of them qualify.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISerializableItem
member.summary: ISerializableItem represents any object that can be serialized via a Sync Point, either directly or via a property in the object graph. Its core feature is that it can return a unique hash representing its content.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISerializableItem.CalculateHash
member.summary: Explicitly recalculates the value of ContentHash - note that similarly to CalculateHash, this cannot return Guid.Empty (a suggested solution is to return the MD5 hash of GetType().FullName if an object has no hashable data)

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISerializableItem.ContentHash
member.summary: A hash representing the content of the object. Note that this should be implemented using a cache-pattern, calling CalculateHash as needed. This property *cannot* be Guid.Empty.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISerializableList
member.summary:
ISerializableList represents a list of serializable objects, which can be serialized as their hashes instead of the actual list items.
This interface exists mainly for the framework, and ISerializableList of T should be used instead.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISerializableList.GetBaseListType
member.summary: GetBaseListType returns the Type of all the items in the list - if the list is heterogenous, return typeof(object).
member.returns: The Type of all the items in the list.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISerializableList.CreatedOn
member.summary: CreatedOn returns the date each item was added to the list.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISerializableList.UpdatedOn
member.summary: XXX: YOU SHOULD PROBABLY REMOVE THIS

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISerializableList`1
member.summary: ISerializableList of T represents a list of serializable objects, which can be serialized as their hashes instead of the actual list items.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISyncPointInformation
member.summary: ISyncPointInformation represents a Sync Point, a commit to the serialization store where we will record the object state. Override this only if you want to commit custom information with a sync point in an Engine implementation, otherwise use SyncPointInformation.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISyncPointInformation.RootObjectHash
member.summary: The content hash of the root object serialized in this sync point.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISyncPointInformation.ParentSyncPoint
member.summary: The content hash of the parent ISyncPointInformation object, or Guid.Empty if this is the initial commit.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISyncPointInformation.RootObjectTypeName
member.summary: The full type name (i.e. Type.FullName) of the root object.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISyncPointInformation.Qualifier
member.summary: An optional string to create separate sync point lists (i.e. "branches") - this is a string provided by the application or null.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISyncPointInformation.CreatedOn
member.summary: The date that the sync point was created.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IObjectSerializationProvider
member.summary:
IObjectSerializationProvider decouples the task of serialization (i.e. reducing an object to its on-disk form) from persistence (i.e. reading/writing the on-disk form to persistent storage).
Most engine implementations will use JsonNetObjectSerializationProvider, but should take a constructor parameter to allow this to be pluggable.
Note that this interface is the interface that does the "Git-like" magic; that is, deconstructing objects into their pieces and instead serializing their content hashes.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IObjectSerializationProvider.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary: Write an object to memory, including serializing all of the child objects in the object graph. This object often needs a reference to the IStorageEngine, to be able to ensure sub-objects are already serialized.
member.param: The root object to serialize to disk.
member.returns: A byte representation of the object.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IObjectSerializationProvider.Deserialize(System.Byte[],System.Type)
member.summary: Reads an object from the data returned by Serialize.
member.param: The byte representation of the object.
The type of the object to reconstruct.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.IObjectSerializationProvider.SerializedDataToString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: SerializedDataToString is a method used for debugging purposes to dump a serialized object out as a string. Production implementations are free to return an empty string.
member.param: A serialized object to examine.
member.returns: The string representation of the byte data (i.e. the JSON string).

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.SyncPointInformationMixin.GetRootObjectType(ReactiveUI.Serialization.ISyncPointInformation)
member.summary: GetRootObjectType returns the Type of the root object associated with the given Sync Point.
member.returns: The Type of the root object.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.RxStorage.InitializeWithEngine(ReactiveUI.Serialization.IStorageEngine)
member.summary: InitializeWithEngine initializes ReactiveUI.Serialization with a storage engine to load and save objects.
member.param: The engine to use.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.NullStorageEngine
member.summary: NullStorageEngine is a test implementation of IStorageEngine that always returns zero results

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.ModelBase
member.summary:
ModelBase represents the base implementation of ISerializableItem and handles a lot of the infrastructure plumbing around maintaining the Content Hash.
For objects who are frequently serialized/deserialized, derived classes should override CalculateHash and implement it in a more specific manner.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.SyncPointInformation.#ctor
member.summary: DONT USE THIS. This only exists to make the serializer not throw a fit

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.DictionaryStorageEngine
member.summary:
DictionaryStorageEngine is an implementation of IStorageEngine designed for testing and debugging purposes; it stores all elements in memory, and optionally persists its store to a JSON file or in Isolated Storage.
This engine is only suited to very small production use-cases, as you will almost certainly run out of memory with large collections.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.DictionaryStorageEngine.Save``1(``0)
member.exception: Cannot serialize object with zero ContentHash

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.JsonNetObjectSerializationProvider.#ctor(ReactiveUI.Serialization.IStorageEngine)
member.summary: Constructs a new JsonNetObjectSerializationProvider.
member.param: The engine to de/serialize dependent sub-objects.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.JsonNetObjectSerializationProvider.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary: Write an object to memory, including serializing all of the child objects in the object graph. In Debug mode, this writes out JSON using Unicode encoding, and in Release mode this writes out BSON.
member.param: The root object to serialize to disk.
member.returns: A byte representation of the object.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.JsonNetObjectSerializationProvider.Deserialize(System.Byte[],System.Type)
member.summary: Reads an object from the data returned by Serialize.
member.param: The byte representation of the object.
The type of the object to reconstruct.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Serialization.JsonNetObjectSerializationProvider.SerializedDataToString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: SerializedDataToString is a method used for debugging purposes to dump a serialized object out as a string. Production implementations are free to return an empty string.
member.param: A serialized object to examine.
member.returns: The string representation of the byte data (i.e. the JSON string).

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.SerializedItemsToGuidResolver
member.summary: This class decides what properties to serialize, and for each property, whether we should hijack the serializer/deserializer.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.SerializableItemConverter
member.summary: This class hijacks ISerializableItems and replaces them with their content hash written out as bytes.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Serialization.SerializableListConverter
member.summary: This class hijacks ISerializableLists and replaces them with a custom class representing the actual data.
